page.title: 20Ribchester in 1953
page.content: On Coronation Day in Ribchester people celebrated on the Rec. At night people dressed up and went in a torch light parade. At the end of Coronation Day everybody got a mug.On the Rec there was a band,racing and stalls etc. In 1953 both cotton mills were working. All the houses were the same apart from Chesterbrook. There was no clinic or playgroup. There was no carpark by the Recreation ground. There were few cars at that time. On November 5th they would have bonfires on the river bank but they had to stop because of the fire risk. The tennis court on the Rec. used to be allotments but now these are near the river. The river has changed course during 1953-1985. And the sewage works used to be where the allotments are now.
